node.text: Gina Chersevani (@mixtressdc) runs one of the coolest spots around, @BuffaloBergenDC, where you’ll find everything from fountain drinks to cocktails, all served alongside bagels, knishes, latkes, and more. Pull up a virtual seat at their bar, and if you’re in DC, be sure to swing by and check out their offerings. 📹 @buckbaymedia

node.title: Throwing it back to one of our 2019 #Imbibe75 People to Watch.

node.text: @ShihoFukada filmed this beautiful video about shochu’s history and culture, how it’s made, and how to use it in cocktails—it will instantly transport you to Japan and inspire you to try shochu yourself. And to learn more about Japanese shochu, be sure to follow @jss_shochu. #shochu #shochucocktail #jss_shochu #partnerpost #imbibe #imbibegram

node.title: The story of Japanese shochu is rich and layered.

node.text: Brewing a batch of Chemex coffee every morning is one of our favorite daily rituals. The classic brewer is a cinch to use, but there are a few little tricks to getting it just right, so our friends @AllegroCoffee put together a helpful how-to. Check it out before you brew your next batch! #chemex #coffeebrewing #coffeefliicks #imbibe #imbibegram

node.text: Lately, we’ve been daydreaming about traveling to Charleston and taking a seat at #TheLivingRoom bar @TheDewberryCharleston, helmed by @prettyprettyryancasey. Join us on a virtual trip to one of our favorite cities and bars. #charlestonsc #charlestonlife #hotelbar #imbibe #imbibegram 📹 @buckbaymedia

node.title: What bars and cities do you miss visiting these days?

node.text: Figuring out the right grind for your favorite brewing methods is key, so our friends @allegrocoffee put together this handy video to break it all down. #coffeefliicks #coffeeathome #coffeegrinder #imbibe #imbibegram

node.title: Have you dialed in your daily coffee grind?

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 18, 2021 tagging @mixography. May be an image of drink.

node.text: Showcasing the versatility of rum, Jim Meehan (@mixography) welcomes the spirit to the Negroni framework in his elegant East India Negroni, named after the East India sherry that he combines with rum and Campari. Check out his recipe via the link in our profile. 📸 @emmajanzen

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Imbibe in J & Tony’s with @prosciuttoboyz. May be an image of indoor.

node.text: The classic Italian aperitivo bar is about more than low-proof cocktails, salty snacks, and breezy patio vibes. It’s also about capturing a time and space for friends to gather and socialize after work and before dinner. And while most aperitivo bars—both traditional Italian venues and their stateside counterparts—tend to embrace a familiar aesthetic, J & Tony’s Discount Cured Meats and Negroni Warehouse (@prosciuttoboyz) in San Diego went their own way by creating a wildly playful and irreverent take on the category. “We wanted to be a proper aperitivo bar,” says Anthony Schmidt (@mr_schmidtters). “But with a San Diego aesthetic and feel.” Head to the link in our profile to take a virtual tour of the bar, which has been participating in #NegroniWeek all week in support of one of our newest nonprofit partners, Keep Memory Alive (@ccnevadakma). 📸 Zach Benson

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 18, 2021 tagging @surfrider. May be an image of coast, nature and ocean.

node.text: One of our long-standing #NegroniWeek fundraising partners is @Surfrider, an organization whose tireless fight for the preservation of oceans and coastlines is more crucial than ever. Beach access, clean water, coastal preservation, ocean protection, and plastic pollution are among the issues Surfrider addresses, and at any given moment, they’re managing more than 100 campaigns that are tackling these challenges. “We’re continuing to fight for the quality of life in beach communities, for the millions of people and countless communities who rely on the coastline and ocean for their livelihoods, for the incredible ecosystem under the water’s surface and for future generations,” says partnerships manager Mary Herbranson. Follow them @Surfrider, and head to surfrider.org to learn more about their work and how you can support their efforts. 📸 courtesy of Jeroen Bendeler

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 17, 2021 tagging @j_thebarman, and @cooperscraft. May be an image of drink.

node.text:
We’re getting some Friday #NegroniWeek inspiration thanks to Jarrett Holborough (be sure to follow him at @J_TheBarman) and his decadent spin on the Boulevardier. "I decided to pick one of my favorite after-work desserts, the Neapolitan, and turn it into cocktail form!” he says. “Three different types of vermouth bring out more of the caramel and vanilla notes in the bourbon." 

Neapolitan Boulevardier 
1½ oz @CoopersCraft Barrel Reserve 100 Proof Bourbon
¾ oz Campari 
¼ oz dry vermouth 
¼ oz sweet vermouth 
¼ oz classico vermouth 
1 barspoon demerara syrup 

Pour all of the ingredients into a mixing glass. Add ice, stir, then strain into a chilled glass. Express a lemon peel over the cocktail, then discard the peel.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 17, 2021 tagging @bolscocktails, and @bolscocktailsusa. May be an image of bottle and indoor.

node.text: Even though genever has been made since the Middle Ages, it hasn’t always enjoyed the ubiquity of modern gin, but that’s changing. It’s a spirit that's versatile enough to work in a myriad of cocktails, including in a Negroni that simply swaps out gin for genever in the classic equal-parts build. Head to the link in our profile to read more about the genever produced by @BolsCocktailsUSA/@BolsCocktails, and to find out where to buy a bottle fr yourself—it’s one you should definitely have on hand.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 17, 2021 tagging @ccnevadakma. May be an image of outdoors.

node.text: Founded in 1996 by Larry Ruvo, Keep Memory Alive (@ccnevadakma) set out to raise funds to provide improved treatment and fuel research for cures for brain diseases including Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s, among others. Ruvo’s father, Lou, passed away from Alzheimer’s in 1994 which drove Ruvo’s philanthropic mission. In 2009, Keep Memory Alive partnered with Cleveland Clinic to open the Cleveland Clinic Lou Ruvo Center for Brain Health in Nevada, which provides state-of-the-art care to patients and their families. The organization is one of our newest #NegroniWeek fundraising partners, and over at negroniweek.com, senior director Anna Robins talks about the power of raising awareness, details on the center’s programs for patients and their caregivers, and how the organization kept up its support during the pandemic—link in our profile. 📸 Courtesy of Cleveland Clinic

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 16, 2021 tagging @simojoaquin. May be an image of drink.

node.text: You didn’t think we’d let #NegronIWeek pass without a Kingston Negroni, did you? Neither should you! Head to the link in our profile for the recipe from Joaquín Simó (@simojoaquin). 📸 @johnvalls_f2.0

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Imbibe in Brother Wolf with @brotherwolfbar. May be an image of drink and indoor.

node.text: Proving that Italian aperitivo culture has been embraced by cities big and small, and across the globe, Knoxville, Tennessee, can now claim to be one of latest destinations for a Negroni, Sbagliato, or Spritz. With 24 aperitivo-style cocktails (including 11 Negroni variations), the newly opened @BrotherWolfBar (also a participating #NegroniWeek venue supporting @wemovement) celebrates aperitivo hour to the fullest, and over at imbibemagazine.com, co-owner Jessica King shares some of her favorite ways to bring the aperitivo spirit home—head to the link in our profile to check it out. 📸 Tommy Blankenship

buttons.text: Visit the COVID-19 Information Center for vaccine resources.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 16, 2021 tagging @imbibe, @bulldog_gin, @campariofficial, @cinzano.official, @bolscocktailsusa, @cooperscraft, and @campariusa. May be an image of text.

node.text: The mission of #NegroniWeek is to raise money and awareness for a wide range of important causes around the world. This year’s list of fundraising partners includes many of our longtime beneficiaries, plus a few new additions, and these 50 organizations work tirelessly to address everything from Covid relief and hospitality support to racial and gender equity to food insecurity, the environment, and much more. Thousands of bars around the world are serving Negronis this week in support of these organizations, and this support will have a meaningful impact on the work they do. Head to negroniweek.com to learn more about these organizations, and to check out participating bars and restaurants in your area. And remember, when you visit your local participating venues, be sure to follow all mask and/or vaccination guidelines, and, of course, be kind to your servers and tip well. ❤️

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 15, 2021 tagging @cinzano.official. May be an image of drink and text.

node.text:
3 ingredients that are sure to make for a perfect day 3 of #NegroniWeek:
💫
1oz gin
1 oz. Campari
1 oz. @Cinzano.Official 1757 Vermouth di Torino Rosso

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 15, 2021 tagging @nicoscarnera. May be an image of 1 person and drink.

node.text: The Sbagliato (meaning “mistaken”) was purportedly invented in the 1970s when Milanese bar owner Mirko Stocchetto somehow mistook a bottle of sparkling wine for gin while preparing a Negroni at Bar Basso. Around half a century later, the riff is still a superstar. “It’s remained popular, in my opinion, because it speaks of an era in which it was possible to do a lot with little,” says @NicoScarnera, an Italy-based Campari Academy bartender. The Sbagliato showed bartenders “the perfect ingredients to create a twist on a classic that could become famous: simplicity of the recipe, ease in finding the ingredients all around the world, name that is easy to remember (and pronounce),” Scarnera says. Head to the link in our profile to read more about the Sbagliato and to check out the recipe. 📸 @johnvalls_f2.0

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 15, 2021 tagging @southernsmoketx. May be an image of ‎text that says '‎TAKING OUR OUR رጥ CARE OF OWN‎'‎.

node.text: Houston chef Chris Shepherd (@cshepherd13) launched the Southern Smoke Foundation in 2015 after learning that a friend and former sommelier had been diagnosed with multiple sclerosis. With the motto “Taking Care of Our Own,” Southern Smoke has raised hundreds of thousands of dollars for the MS Society, but the organization has quickly expanded over the years to address many crises, including Hurricane Harvey in 2017, the ongoing COVID crisis, and, most recently, Hurricane Ida. Southern Smoke’s Emergency Relief Fund supports the entire food and beverage chain—from farmers and winemakers to dishwashers and servers—in all 50 states, and they provide funds directly to people who are battling health crises, storm damage, natural disasters, mental health needs, and the ongoing pandemic. We're thrilled to have them for the second year as a #NegroniWeek nonprofit partner and thank all of the participating venues that are supporting them this week. Follow them @southernsmoketx and head to southernsmoke.org to learn more about their work and to find how you can either donate or receive assistance.
